block.p: Emily Alice Frug, the daughter of Gerald Frug of Cambridge, Mass., and the late Mary Joe Frug, is to be married today to Jeffrey David Klineman, the son of Barbara and William Klineman of Atlanta. Rabbi Jonathan Kraus is to officiate at the First Parish Meeting House in Cambridge.
The couple graduated from Yale, the bride cum laude.

Emily Alice Frug, the daughter of Gerald Frug of Cambridge, Mass., and the late Mary Joe Frug, is to be married today to Jeffrey David Klineman, the son of Barbara and William Klineman of Atlanta. Rabbi Jonathan Kraus is to officiate at the First Parish Meeting House in Cambridge.
The couple graduated from Yale, the bride cum laude.

The bride, 26, is to begin next month as a clerk for Judge Robert E. Keeton of Federal District Court in Boston. She graduated cum laude from Harvard Law School in Cambridge, where her father is the Louis D. Brandeis professor of urban law. Her mother was a professor at the New England School of Law in Boston.

The bridegroom, 28, is a reporter at The Lawrence Eagle-Tribune, a daily newspaper in Lawrence, Mass. He received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia. His father is a vice president of Contract Apparel Network, a company in Snellville, Ga., that finds labor and materials for clothing manufacturers.
